intro: Moquiniastrum glabrum, commonly known as the smooth moquinia, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Poaceae, commonly known as the grass family, and is characterized by its slender, upright growth habit. The plant features narrow, linear leaves that are smooth and hairless, giving it its common name. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically arranged in clusters at the base of the plant. Moquiniastrum glabrum is often found in wetland habitats, such as marshes and swamps, where it thrives in moist, nutrient-rich soils.
